metadata.titleEn: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network: automatic weather station of Zhangye wetland station, 2022
metadata.titleCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网：张掖湿地站自动气象站（2022）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Zhangye wetland station from January 1 to December 31, 2022. The site (100.4464° E, 38.9751° N) was located on a wetland (reed surface) in Zhangye National Wetland Park, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1460 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45AC; 5 and 10 m, north), wind speed profile (03002; 5 and 10 m, north), wind direction profile (03002; 10 m, north), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 10 m), four-component radiometer (CNR1; 6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (109ss-L; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2 and -0.4 m), and four photosynthetically active radiation (PQS-1; two above the plants, 6 m, south, one vertically downward and one vertically upward; two below the plants, 0.25 m, south, one vertically downward and one vertically upward).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m and Ta_10 m; RH_5 m and RH_10 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_5 m and Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm and Ts_40 cm) (℃), on the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_U_up and PAR_U_down) (μmol/ (s m^2)), and below the plants photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_D_up and PAR_D_down) (μmol/ (s m^-2)).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2022-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2022年1月1日至2022年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游张掖湿地站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市国家湿地公园，下垫面是芦苇湿地。观测点的经纬度是100.4464E, 38.9751N，海拔1460m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m处，风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处；四个光合有效辐射仪分别架设在冠层上方和冠层内，冠层上方安装在6m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）、冠层内安装在0.25m（探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个）高处，朝向正南。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm）(单位：摄氏度)、冠层上向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)和冠层下向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_D_up、PAR_D_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2022-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（斯坦耶夫等，2004；克雷托等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（斯通，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Is the data collection method for meteorological observations in the field using automatic weather stations?
Verification.QuestionCn: 气象观测的现场数据收集方法是使用自动气象站吗？

Verification.QuestionEn: Is there a dataset available that includes both energy and water vapor fluxes in oasis–desert areas?
Verification.QuestionCn: 是否有可用的数据集，包括绿洲-沙漠地区的能量和水汽通量？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are the data collection methods for monitoring oasis-desert ecosystems primarily based on eddy covariance systems, automatic weather stations, or scintillometers?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统的数据收集方法主要基于涡度协方差系统、自动气象站还是闪烁仪？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas typically available from national data centers, university repositories, or private organizations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在国家数据中心、大学库或私人组织中，绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据集通常是可用的。
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 国家青藏高原科学数据中心

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are the observational datasets from oasis–desert systems typically collected?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集通常在哪里收集？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced in maintaining ecological stability in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域中，维护生态稳定面临哪些挑战？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: drying up of rivers and lakes

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used in arid and semiarid regions to monitor energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个在干旱和半干旱地区用于监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method used in arid and semiarid regions is the use of automatic weather stations which gather hydrometeorological data including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. These stations collect data with a 10-minute average period.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区使用的一种数据收集方法是自动气象站，这些气象站收集水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。这些站点以10分钟的平均周期收集数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a dataset that provides long-term observations of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个提供绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量长期观测的数据集的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset comprises observations from 2012 to 2021, collected from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems. This dataset includes energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes along with auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子包括从2012年到2021年的观察数据，收集自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统。该数据集包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a challenge faced in data collection in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域，数据收集面临的一个挑战是缺乏可靠的水文监测站点。
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in data collection in these regions includes dealing with the ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, particularly in areas like the Tarim River basin and the Aral Sea basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在这些地区，数据收集面临的一个挑战是应对生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，特别是在塔里木河流域和阿拉尔海流域。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific characteristics of the meteorological data collection methods used in arid and semiarid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 干旱和半干旱地区气象数据收集方法的具体特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: automatic weather stations, 10-minute average period, air temperature, humidity gradients, wind speed, wind direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, sensors placed at specific heights
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 自动气象站，10分钟平均周期，空气温度，湿度梯度，风速，风向，气压，降水，土壤热通量，土壤温度剖面，传感器放置在特定高度。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with maintaining long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 维护绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观测数据集面临哪些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: ecological degradation, drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, frequent dust storms
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 生态退化、河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地荒漠化、频繁的沙尘暴

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics and components of datasets collected in oasis–desert systems for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange studies?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在研究绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时，收集的数据集的特征和组成包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, methane fluxes, hydrometeorology data, vegetation data, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、甲烷通量、水文气象数据、植被数据、土壤参数

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many meteorological elements are measured at the automatic weather station in the Zhangye Wetland site?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 张掖湿地站的自动气象站测量了多少个气象要素？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations are established in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在黑河流域中下游地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of data collection for meteorological elements at the automatic weather stations in the field?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在野外自动气象站中，气象要素的数据收集频率是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'data quality control' mean in the context of meteorological data collection in arid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的气象数据收集中，“数据质量控制”指的是确保收集到的数据准确、可靠和一致的过程。这包括对数据进行验证、校正和审查，以排除错误和异常值，从而提高数据的整体质量和可用性。
Definition.AnswerEn: Data quality control in the context of meteorological data collection in arid regions involves ensuring consistent data capture, removing duplicate records, deleting data that are evidently beyond physical meaning or instrument range, marking questionable data, and standardizing date and time formats.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区的气象数据收集中，数据质量控制涉及确保数据捕获的一致性、删除重复记录、删除明显超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据、标记可疑数据以及标准化日期和时间格式。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations' in oasis–desert areas?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，“能量、水汽和碳交换观测”是指对这些区域内能量、水汽和二氧化碳等物质交换过程的监测和研究。
Definition.AnswerEn: Energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas refer to the collection of data on the transfer of energy, water vapor, and carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere, typically involving measurements from land surface flux and meteorological stations, including auxiliary data like hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Definition.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换观测是指对能量、水汽和碳在陆地表面与大气之间转移的数据收集，通常涉及来自陆地表面通量和气象站的测量，包括水文气象、植被和土壤参数等辅助数据。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is an 'automatic weather station' and how is it used in the context of collecting data in arid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 自动气象站是什么，它在干旱地区收集数据的背景下如何使用？
Definition.AnswerEn: An automatic weather station is a facility equipped with instruments and sensors to automatically measure and record meteorological data such as temperature, humidity, air pressure, wind speed and direction, and precipitation. In arid regions, such stations are used to provide continuous, high-frequency data essential for understanding local climate dynamics and interactions in ecosystems like oases and deserts.
Definition.AnswerCn: 自动气象站是一个配备仪器和传感器的设施，用于自动测量和记录气象数据，如温度、湿度、气压、风速和风向以及降水量。在干旱地区，这些站点用于提供连续的高频数据，这对于理解当地气候动态和生态系统（如绿洲和沙漠）之间的相互作用至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the measurement techniques for air temperature and humidity differ between meteorological stations located in the middle and lower reaches of river basins compared to those in wetland areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 中下游河流流域的气象站与湿地地区的气象站在空气温度和湿度的测量技术上有哪些不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Air temperature and humidity in wetland areas are measured using sensors at specific heights (5m and 10m) with a systematic orientation, while in river basins, they are part of broader hydrometeorological data collection efforts that include multiple parameters, possibly indicating a more integrated approach involving gradients of temperature and humidity.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 湿地地区的空气温度和湿度通过传感器在特定高度（5米和10米）进行测量，具有系统的方向性；而在河流流域，这些数据则是更广泛的水文气象数据收集工作的一部分，可能表明一种更综合的方法，涉及温度和湿度的梯度。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of multiple sensor types for measuring atmospheric and soil parameters enhance the reliability of data interpretation in arid and semi-arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多种传感器类型的集成用于测量干旱和半干旱地区的气象和土壤参数，如何增强数据解释的可靠性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating multiple sensor types can enhance data reliability by providing a comprehensive view of the environmental conditions. Atmospheric parameters like temperature, humidity, and pressure, when measured at various heights, allow for detailed vertical profiling of the atmosphere. Similarly, soil temperature and heat flux sensors at different depths provide insights into subsurface conditions. This multi-layered approach helps in cross-verifying data, reducing uncertainty, and improving the robustness of interpretations related to energy, water, and carbon exchanges in arid and semi-arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 整合多种传感器类型可以通过提供环境条件的全面视角来增强数据的可靠性。大气参数如温度、湿度和压力在不同高度的测量，能够对大气进行详细的垂直剖面分析。同样，土壤温度和不同深度的热通量传感器提供了对地下条件的洞察。这种多层次的方法有助于交叉验证数据，减少不确定性，并改善与干旱和半干旱地区能量、水和碳交换相关的解释的稳健性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the necessity for long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期观察的必要性受到以下因素的影响：
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这对认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is ensuring the balance between oasis and desert systems critical for sustainable development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 确保绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对可持续发展至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area, supporting ecological security and sustainable development, as oases are crucial for the ecological environment and economic development in arid and semi-arid regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 保持平衡对于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标至关重要，这支持了生态安全和可持续发展，因为绿洲在干旱和半干旱地区的生态环境和经济发展中至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the degradation of ecological environments in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域生态环境退化的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Ecological environment degradation is caused by factors such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, particularly in inland river basins along the Silk Road.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态环境退化是由多种因素造成的，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，特别是在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of integrating long-term observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems on understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 整合人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集对理解这些生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating long-term observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems can enhance the quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions. This knowledge is significant for protecting ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in oasis regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的长期观测数据集，可以增强对能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲–沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这些知识对保护生态稳定性和支持绿洲地区的可持续发展具有重要意义。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the establishment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations impact the quality and depth of data collected in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多个地表通量和气象站的建立将如何影响干旱地区收集数据的质量和深度？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The establishment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations can improve the quality and depth of data collected by providing comprehensive and diverse observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, as well as hydrometeorological data and vegetation and soil parameters. This can lead to a more detailed understanding of environmental processes in arid regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 建立多个地表通量和气象站可以通过提供全面和多样的能量、水汽和碳通量观测，以及水文气象数据和植被与土壤参数，来提高数据收集的质量和深度。这可以导致对干旱地区环境过程的更详细理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the likely outcomes of utilizing a suite of observational datasets from oasis–desert systems for addressing ecological and socioeconomic challenges in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用来自绿洲-沙漠系统的一套观察性数据集来应对干旱地区的生态和社会经济挑战的可能结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing a suite of observational datasets from oasis–desert systems can help address ecological and socioeconomic challenges by providing data essential for maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems. This can contribute to achieving sustainable oasis development, ecological security, and socioeconomic stability in arid regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用来自绿洲-沙漠系统的一系列观测数据集，可以帮助解决生态和社会经济挑战，提供维持绿洲与沙漠系统平衡所需的数据。这有助于实现可持续的绿洲发展、生态安全和干旱地区的社会经济稳定。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the underlying goals of conducting long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 进行对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测的基本目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals are to achieve a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, protecting the ecological stability, supporting the socioeconomic development of oases, and achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用、保护生态稳定、支持绿洲的社会经济发展以及实现碳达峰和碳中和目标至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of sustainable development?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在可持续发展的背景下，维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is critical to support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis, as these regions are essential for the ecological environment and economic development, especially in arid and semiarid areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要，因为这些地区对生态环境和经济发展至关重要，尤其是在干旱和半干旱地区。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What motivates the inclusion of auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters in datasets focused on oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在关注绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集中，包含水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据的动机是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Including auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters helps provide a comprehensive understanding of the interactions within oasis–desert systems, supporting the analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes and aiding in the protection and sustainable development of these areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 包括与水文气象、植被和土壤参数相关的辅助数据，有助于全面理解绿洲-沙漠系统内的相互作用，支持能量、水汽和碳通量的分析，并有助于这些地区的保护和可持续发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are data collection and quality control processes designed to handle missing or erroneous data in climatic datasets?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 气候数据集中的数据收集和质量控制过程是如何设计来处理缺失或错误数据的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection process involves ensuring a consistent data acquisition rate, with 144 data points collected each day at 10-minute intervals. Quality control includes marking missing data with a placeholder value (-6999), removing duplicate records, and discarding data that exceed physical or instrument limits. Any data marked with red highlights are flagged for potential issues. A unified format for date and time is maintained to ensure consistency across records.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集过程涉及确保一致的数据采集速率，每天以10分钟的间隔收集144个数据点。质量控制包括用占位符值（-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，以及丢弃超过物理或仪器限制的数据。任何用红色高亮标记的数据都被标记为潜在问题。统一的日期和时间格式得以保持，以确保记录的一致性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the comprehensive monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的全面监测成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for half-hourly turbulent flux data collection, along with automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data, enables comprehensive monitoring in these ecosystems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行半小时湍流通量数据收集，以及自动气象站用于水文气象数据的收集，使得对这些生态系统的综合监测成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do data quality control measures ensure the reliability of meteorological datasets collected from arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 数据质量控制措施如何确保从干旱地区收集的气象数据集的可靠性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data quality control measures such as ensuring a specific number of daily data points, marking missing data, removing duplicates, and excluding out-of-range measurements help ensure dataset reliability.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制措施，如确保每天特定数量的数据点、标记缺失数据、删除重复数据和排除超范围测量，有助于确保数据集的可靠性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways can the integration of auxiliary data like vegetation and soil parameters enhance the understanding of oasis–desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 辅助数据如植被和土壤参数的整合可以通过以下方式增强对绿洲-沙漠系统的理解：
Enablement.AnswerEn: Integrating auxiliary data like vegetation and soil parameters with energy, water vapor, and carbon flux observations provides a more comprehensive understanding of interactions within oasis–desert systems, supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 将植被和土壤参数等辅助数据与能量、水汽和碳通量观测相结合，可以更全面地理解绿洲-沙漠系统内的相互作用，从而支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in maintaining long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems, and how might these challenges affect data accuracy and reliability?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在维持绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集时，预期会面临哪些挑战，这些挑战可能如何影响数据的准确性和可靠性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, and dust storms. These conditions present challenges for maintaining accurate and reliable datasets over long periods.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的问题，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化以及沙尘暴。这些条件给长期维持准确可靠的数据集带来了挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might certain hydrometeorological data, such as soil temperature profiles and groundwater table data, be expected to have high variability in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 某些水文气象数据，如土壤温度剖面和地下水位数据，在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中可能会有很高的变异性，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: High variability in hydrometeorological data can be expected due to the unique ecological landscape of oases in arid regions, which significantly affect energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, influencing soil temperature profiles and groundwater levels.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于干旱地区绿洲独特的生态景观，水文气象数据的高变异性是可以预期的，这显著影响了能量、水汽和碳的交换，从而影响土壤温度剖面和地下水位。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated benefits of integrating auxiliary data involving vegetation and soil parameters with meteorological observations in understanding oasis–desert interactions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 整合涉及植被和土壤参数的辅助数据与气象观测，以理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，预期将带来以下好处：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Integrating auxiliary data with meteorological observations helps in achieving a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and ensuring ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 将辅助数据与气象观测相结合，有助于实现对能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用以及确保绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the perceived challenges in maintaining data quality and continuity in long-term meteorological studies in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期气象研究中，维护数据质量和连续性面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The challenges in maintaining data quality and continuity include dealing with data gaps, ensuring accurate calibration of sensors, and managing environmental factors that might affect measurements, such as extreme weather conditions. The data processing steps, such as removing data with obvious physical inconsistencies and marking doubtful data, are crucial in addressing these challenges.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 维护数据质量和连续性面临的挑战包括处理数据缺口、确保传感器的准确校准，以及管理可能影响测量的环境因素，如极端天气条件。数据处理步骤，如去除明显物理不一致的数据和标记可疑数据，对于应对这些挑战至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm not clear on what challenges researchers face when collecting long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不清楚研究人员在收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的长期能量、水汽和碳交换数据时面临哪些挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Researchers face challenges such as ecological environment degradation, including drying up of rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues can impact the stability of observations and the physical conditions where data is collected, adding complexity to maintaining continuous high-quality datasets.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 研究人员面临着生态环境退化的挑战，包括河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题可能影响观测的稳定性和数据收集的物理条件，增加了维持连续高质量数据集的复杂性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection methods used for capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve using observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis-desert systems, which include long-term measurements of energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, and auxiliary data related to hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. The primary instruments are the eddy covariance system and scintillometer for half-hourly turbulent flux data, and automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute average period.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及使用来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期测量，以及与水文气象、植被和土壤参数相关的辅助数据。主要仪器包括涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以及自动气象站，用于以10分钟平均周期收集水文气象数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in collecting data in inland river basins within arid and semiarid areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域收集数据所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting data in these regions include ecological environment degradation such as drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensified land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are prevalent in inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, impacting data collection efforts.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在这些地区收集数据的挑战包括生态环境退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域普遍存在，影响了数据收集工作。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please suggest potential strategies for expanding or refining datasets related to oasis-desert systems in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请建议潜在的策略，以扩展或完善与干旱地区绿洲-沙漠系统相关的数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: A potential strategy could include establishing additional land surface flux and meteorological stations in critical areas to capture more detailed spatial variations. Also, integrating remote sensing data with field observations could enhance spatial and temporal coverage. Long-term and continuous data collection, along with comprehensive data processing and quality control procedures, would ensure dataset reliability and usefulness.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 一个潜在的策略可以包括在关键区域建立更多的陆地表面通量和气象站，以捕捉更详细的空间变化。此外，将遥感数据与实地观测相结合，可以增强空间和时间的覆盖。长期和持续的数据收集，以及全面的数据处理和质量控制程序，将确保数据集的可靠性和实用性。
